intro: Coccoloba bonfilsiana, commonly known as the Caribbean beauty or red mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, often found in coastal areas and brackish water environments. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple foliage, which becomes more vibrant during the cooler months. It has small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. This species is adapted to saline conditions and plays an important role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
